intro.description:
This tutorial will get you started with using Scala in the Eclipse IDE.
You will learn how to create a new Scala application, and how to run and debug it.

item.title: Switch to the Scala perspective
item.description: Let's start by switching to the Scala perspective. This brings in all the Scala-related views and menus.

item.title: Create a Scala project
item.description:
Next, let's ceate a Scala project. A Scala project holds together related source files and configuration (like classpath and compiler settings).
Everything you do in Eclipse is based on a project.
Click below to create a project. Choose a name and click Finish.

item.title: Create a Scala object
item.description:
Let's start by creating a Scala object that extends App.
Unlike Java, Scala has top-level objects. A top-level object is a singleton, and it is initialized on first access. By making an object extend App, we make it runnable: everything inside the object will be executed.
Right click on the project and select New Scala Object. Make sure to choose the source folder in the project you just created. Also, enter a name for the object, like Main and a package name. The corresponding folders will be created for you.
Using the default (empty) package is strongly discouraged.

item.title: Run a Scala program
item.description:
Let's add some code and run the program.
println("Hello, world")
Now right click and choose Run As > Scala Application. You should see the output in the Console window.
